    Load GIFs and images.

    BananaPuncher714

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleImage

        public SimpleImage(java.io.File file)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • SimpleImage

        public SimpleImage(java.io.File file,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   int hints)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Construct a SimpleImage with the arguments provided.
        Parameters:
        file - Must not be null, exist, and be a file.
        width - The width that this image should be resized to.
        height - The height that this image should be resized to.
        hints - Resizing hints. For example, Image.SCALE_REPLICATE.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Look for ImageIO.read( File ).

      • SimpleImage

        public SimpleImage(java.awt.Image image,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   int hints)
        Construct a SimpleImage with the arguments provided.
        Parameters:
        image - Cannot be null.
        width - The width that this image should be resized to.
        height - The height that this image should be resized to.
        hints - Resizing hints. For example, Image.SCALE_REPLICATE.

      • SimpleImage

        public SimpleImage(SimpleImage image,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   int hints)
        Construct a resized SimpleImage with the arguments provided.
        Parameters:
        image - Another SimpleImage, cannot be null.
        width - The new width.
        height - The new height.
        hints - Resizing hints. For example, Image.SCALE_REPLICATE.

    • Method Detail

      • getBufferedImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBufferedImage()
        Get the current image.
        Returns:
        If the image is a GIF, then whichever frame should be displayed currently according to the time of creation.

        Returns:
        The image located at the given index.

      • getImage

        public int[] getImage()
        Get the ARGB buffer for the current image.
        Returns:
        If the image is a GIF, then whichever frame should be displayed currently according to the time of creation.

      • getImage

        public int[] getImage(int index)
        Get the ARGB buffer at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the buffer.
        Returns:
        The ARGB buffer located at the given index.

      • getDelay

        public int getDelay(int index)
        Get the delay at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the delay.
        Returns:
        The delay in milliseconds until the next frame.

      • getFrames

        public int getFrames()
        Get the amount of frames.
        Returns:
        Will return 1 if it is a single image.
